verses.verse: Keep <S%H8104><s%> your foot <S%H7272><s%> when <S%H834><s%> you go <S%H3212><s%> to the house <S%H1004><s%> of God, <S%H430><s%> and be more <S%H7138><s%> ready <S%H7138><s%> to hear, <S%H8085><s%> than to give <S%H5414><s%> the sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> of fools: <S%H3684><s%> for they consider <S%H3045><s%> not that they do <S%H6213><s%> evil. <S%H7451><s%>

Be not rash <S%H926><s%> with your mouth, <S%H6310><s%> and let not your heart <S%H3820><s%> be hasty <S%H4116><s%> to utter <S%H3318><s%> any thing <S%H1697><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> God: <S%H430><s%> for God <S%H430><s%> is in heaven, <S%H8064><s%> and you on earth: <S%H776><s%> therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> let your words <S%H1697><s%> be few. <S%H4592><s%>

For a dream <S%H2472><s%> comes <S%H935><s%> through the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of business; <S%H6045><s%> and a fool's <S%H3684><s%> voice <S%H6963><s%> is known by multitude <S%H7230><s%> of words. <S%H1697><s%>

When <S%H834><s%> you vow <S%H5087><s%> a vow <S%H5088><s%> to God, <S%H430><s%> defer <S%H309><s%> not to pay <S%H7999><s%> it; for he has no <S%H369><s%> pleasure <S%H2656><s%> in fools: <S%H3684><s%> pay <S%H7999><s%> that which <S%H834><s%> you have vowed. <S%H5087><s%>
Better <S%H2896><s%> is it that you should not vow, <S%H5087><s%> than that you should vow <S%H5087><s%> and not pay. <S%H7999><s%>

Suffer <S%H5414><s%> not your mouth <S%H6310><s%> to cause your flesh <S%H1320><s%> to sin; <S%H2398><s%> neither <S%H408><s%> say <S%H559><s%> you before <S%H6440><s%> the angel, <S%H4397><s%> that it was an error: <S%H7684><s%> why <S%H4100><s%> should God <S%H430><s%> be angry <S%H7107><s%> at <S%H5921><s%> your voice, <S%H6963><s%> and destroy <S%H2254><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of your hands? <S%H3027><s%>
For in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of dreams <S%H2472><s%> and many <S%H7230><s%> words <S%H1697><s%> there are also divers vanities: <S%H1892><s%> but fear <S%H3372><s%> you God. <S%H430><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> you see <S%H7200><s%> the oppression <S%H6233><s%> of the poor, <S%H7326><s%> and violent <S%H1499><s%> perverting of judgment <S%H4941><s%> and justice <S%H6664><s%> in a province, <S%H4082><s%> marvel <S%H8539><s%> not at <S%H5921><s%> the matter: <S%H2656><s%> for he that is higher <S%H1364><s%> than <S%H5921><s%> the highest <S%H1364><s%> regards; <S%H8104><s%> and there be higher <S%H1364><s%> than <S%H5921><s%> they.
Moreover the profit <S%H3504><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> is for all: <S%H3605><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> himself is served <S%H5647><s%> by the field. <S%H7704><s%>

He that loves <S%H157><s%> silver <S%H3701><s%> shall not be satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with silver; <S%H3701><s%> nor he that loves <S%H157><s%> abundance <S%H1995><s%> with increase: <S%H8393><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> is also <S%H1571><s%> vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

When goods <S%H2896><s%> increase, <S%H7235><s%> they are increased <S%H7231><s%> that eat <S%H398><s%> them: and what <S%H4100><s%> good <S%H3788><s%> is there to the owners <S%H1167><s%> thereof, saving <S%H518><s%> the beholding <S%H7200><s%> of them with their eyes? <S%H5869><s%>

The sleep <S%H8142><s%> of a laboring <S%H5647><s%> man is sweet, <S%H4966><s%> whether <S%H518><s%> he eat <S%H398><s%> little <S%H4592><s%> or much: <S%H7235><s%> but the abundance <S%H7647><s%> of the rich <S%H6223><s%> will not suffer <S%H3240><s%> him to sleep. <S%H3462><s%>

There is a sore <S%H2470><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> which I have seen <S%H7200><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun, <S%H8121><s%> namely, riches <S%H6239><s%> kept <S%H8104><s%> for the owners <S%H1167><s%> thereof to their hurt. <S%H7451><s%>

But those <S%H1931><s%> riches <S%H6239><s%> perish <S%H6><s%> by evil <S%H7451><s%> travail: <S%H6045><s%> and he begets <S%H3205><s%> a son, <S%H1121><s%> and there is nothing <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3972><s%> in his hand. <S%H3027><s%>

As he came <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> of his mother's <S%H517><s%> womb, <S%H990><s%> naked <S%H6174><s%> shall he return <S%H7725><s%> to go <S%H3212><s%> as he came, <S%H935><s%> and shall take <S%H5375><s%> nothing <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3972><s%> of his labor, <S%H5999><s%> which he may carry <S%H3212><s%> away in his hand. <S%H3027><s%>

And this <S%H2090><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> is a sore <S%H2470><s%> evil, <S%H7451><s%> that in all <S%H3605><s%> points <S%H5980><s%> as he came, <S%H935><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> shall he go: <S%H3212><s%> and what <S%H4100><s%> profit <S%H3504><s%> has he that has labored <S%H5998><s%> for the wind? <S%H7307><s%>

All <S%H3605><s%> his days <S%H3117><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> he eats <S%H398><s%> in darkness, <S%H2822><s%> and he has much <S%H7235><s%> sorrow <S%H3708><s%> and wrath <S%H7110><s%> with his sickness. <S%H2483><s%>

Behold <S%H2009><s%> that which <S%H834><s%> I have seen: <S%H7200><s%> it is good <S%H2896><s%> and comely <S%H3303><s%> for one to eat <S%H398><s%> and to drink, <S%H8354><s%> and to enjoy <S%H7200><s%> the good <S%H2896><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> his labor <S%H5999><s%> that he takes <S%H5998><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%> all <S%H4557><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of his life, <S%H2416><s%> which <S%H834><s%> God <S%H430><s%> gives <S%H5414><s%> him: for it is his portion. <S%H2506><s%>

Every <S%H3605><s%> man <S%H120><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> to whom <S%H834><s%> God <S%H430><s%> has given <S%H5414><s%> riches <S%H6239><s%> and wealth, <S%H5233><s%> and has given him power <S%H7980><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> thereof, and to take <S%H5375><s%> his portion, <S%H2506><s%> and to rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in his labor; <S%H5999><s%> this <S%H2090><s%> is the gift <S%H4991><s%> of God. <S%H430><s%>

For he shall not much <S%H7235><s%> remember <S%H2142><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of his life; <S%H2416><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> God <S%H430><s%> answers <S%H6030><s%> him in the joy <S%H8057><s%> of his heart. <S%H3820><s%>
